intro: Manulea benthamiana, commonly known as the Benthams' manulea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, and it produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring. Manulea benthamiana is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
